Package duration

Interface Duration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Duration>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompactDuration, HmsDuration
    public interface Duration
extends java.lang.Comparable<Duration>
    Durations, with a resolution of seconds. All durations are non-negative.

    Different Duration implementations should work together, meaning that:

    • Two durations must be equal if they have the same number of seconds.
    • The hash code of a duration is the result of calling Long.hashCode(long) on its length in seconds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String asHms()
      Formats this duration in the form H:MM:SS where the hours and minutes are both zero-padded to two digits, but the hours are not.
      long inSeconds()
      Gets the total duration in seconds.
      Duration plus​(Duration other)
      Returns the sum of two durations.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • inSeconds

        long inSeconds()
        Gets the total duration in seconds.
        Returns:
        the number of seconds (non-negative)

      • asHms

        java.lang.String asHms()
        Formats this duration in the form H:MM:SS where the hours and minutes are both zero-padded to two digits, but the hours are not. The duration should be in canonical form, meaning that both the minutes and the seconds are less than 60.
        Returns:
        this duration formatted in hours, minutes, and seconds

      • plus

        Duration plus​(Duration other)
        Returns the sum of two durations.
        Parameters:
        other - the duration to add to this
        Returns:
        the sum of the durations
